At some point I wrote code for the star-subalgebra of exponential polynomials (which is the same as what you do for `probChar_starSubalgebra`, but I did not take a general `AddChar`). I took some time today to generalize my code to match the generality you assumed, for the sake of comparison with yours. It's here: https://github.com/RemyDegenne/CLT/blob/tight/Clt/ExpPoly.lean (in the section `PR` at the beginning of the file; disregard the bad names for the defs).

The way I did it was to first define a monoid homomorphism `Multiplicative W ‚Üí* (V ‚Üí·µá ‚ÑÇ)` from `probChar`. The monoid homomorphism can be lifted to a homomorphism of algebras from `AddMonoidAlgebra ‚Ñù W` to `V ‚Üí·µá ‚ÑÇ` using `AddMonoidAlgebra.lift`. The subalgebra we want is the range of this homomorphism. The ‚Äústar‚Äù part can finally be checked easily. The proofs of separation are copied (and minimally adapted) from your code.
It looks like that approach leads to simpler proofs compared to what you did, and it avoids the big proof of boundedness you have in `probChar_starSubalgebra_bounded`. What do you think?

Nice! Compared to your code, I now defined `expPoly` as subalgebra over `‚ÑÇ` instead of `‚Ñù`, which makes it easier to apply `ext_of_forall_mem_subalgbra_integral_eq_of_pseudoEMetric_complete_countable`. 

As an example, this can be used to show that moment generating functions are separating. I added some code on this, what do you think?

Are all the results about `span` used for anything? If not, could you remove them from this PR?
By the way, I wrote too much of the `probChar` code to merge this myself, so I'll find someone else to do the final review and merge.

> The name and the placement of the file `FiniteMeasureCharFun` are a bit strange to me. Why is it in the Integral folder? Since it is defined from a measure, I would have put it in the Measure folder. And the name of the file could perhaps be `CharacteristicFunction`?
> 
> You don't actually add a definition for the characteristic function. Perhaps it would be worth adding a definition `charFun P hL w` to refer to the integral of `probChar` for the standard choice of `e = probFourierChar` (which I want to rename to `Circle.expAddChar`, see my previous comments) ? We also probably want another definition that chooses L for special cases, but we can keep that for future PRs.

I added a definition of `charFun P hL w`. I renamed the previous extensionality result and added a new theorem `ext_of_charFun_eq`. The latter is now used to show that `complexMGF` separates measures.
